column4: Install a video card, plug in a monitor, and run, "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" from the command line and follow the prompts. :-)
That assumes you installed a graphical environment, etc.
I have gnome and kde both installed
Then you should be in business :-)
I did the reconfig and I still get the same error reports
Bummer!  Is the video adapter being recognized during autodetection?  If not, you might need to edit your xorg.conf file manually and enter the bus id for it.
What is the error you get when gdm tries to start?
it saus that no symbols found, no devices found, no sreens found
Also, what video adapter are you using?
Well anyway, good luck with it... I'm off to bed now!
Wish I had time to help further but I have to be up in 5 and a half hours!
